title: Trump announces more than $200bn of deals between US and UAE
snippets:
Pledge to strengthen ties with Gulf state includes a $14.5bn agreement with Boeing, GE Aerospace and Etihad Airways

Donald Trump has announced deals totaling more than $200bn between the United States and the United Arab Emirates, including a $14.5bn commitment among Boeing, GE Aerospace and Etihad Airways, as he pledged to strengthen ties between the US and the Gulf state during a multiday trip to the Middle East.

The White House said on Thursday that Boeing and GE had received a commitment from Etihad Airways to invest $14.5bn to buy 28 US-made Boeing 787 and 777X aircraft powered by GE engines.

Continue reading...
titles: Trump announces more than $200bn of deals between US and UAE
summary: Donald Trump announced over $200bn in deals between the US and the United Arab Emirates, highlighting a $14.5bn agreement involving Boeing, GE Aerospace, and Etihad Airways. The deal includes Etihad Airways' commitment to purchase 28 Boeing 787 and 777X aircraft, powered by GE engines, strengthening US-UAE ties.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information on economic developments between the US and UAE, which could influence decision-making in related industries. It reports on a solution to strengthen ties between the two countries. However, it could provide more context on the implications of these deals for a broader audience.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Sheds Citi Stake, Trims Other Big Bank Holdings
snippets:
Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) sold its shares of Citigroup (C) during the first quarter, while trimming its stakes in Bank of America (BAC) and Capital One (COF).

Berkshire shed its more than 14.6 million shares of Citigroup in the first three months of the year, a 13-F filing revealed Thursday. The form, which offers a snapshot of Berkshire's portfolio at the end of the quarter, does not capture any changes the company would have made since the end of March.

The conglomerate also trimmed its long-term holding in Bank of America by 48.6 million shares. It reduced its stake in Capital One by 300,000 shares, and shed all its shares in Brazilian fintech firm Nu Holdings (NU). Berkshire shrank its Liberty Media Series C Formula One (FWONK) stake, and sold shares of Charter Communications (CHTR), DaVita (DVA), and T-Mobile (TMUS) too.

Meanwhile, Buffett's firm more than doubled its position in alcoholic beverage maker Constellation Brands (STZ) to just over 12 million shares. Shares of the Modelo parent climbed close to 3% in after-hours trading.

Berkshire also added nearly 240,000 shares of Domino's Pizza (DPZ) and over 112,000 shares of electronics firm Heico (HEI). It expanded positions in VeriSign (VRSN), Sirius XM (SIRI), Pool Corp. (POOL), and Occidental Petroleum (OXY) as well.

After trimming its stake in Apple (AAPL) last year, Berkshire did not make any changes to its position in the iPhone maker during the period.

Shares of Berkshire have taken a hit in the wake of Buffett's announcement earlier this month that he plans to step down as CEO, with vice chair Greg Abel set to take the helm at year-end. Still, they’ve outperformed the broader market, with shares up about 12% since the start of the year, while the S&P 500 added just 0.6%.
titles: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Sheds Citi Stake, Trims Other Big Bank Holdings
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold its Citigroup shares and reduced stakes in Bank of America, Capital One, and several other companies in the first quarter, as per a 13-F filing. Meanwhile, Berkshire increased its holdings in Constellation Brands, Domino's Pizza, Heico, and expanded positions in several other firms. Despite Buffett announcing his plan to step down as CEO by year-end, Berkshire Hathaway shares have still outperformed the broader market in 2025, with a 12% increase compared to the S&P 500's 0.6% rise.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful information about Berkshire Hathaway's recent investment decisions, which can help readers understand the company's strategy and the potential impact on the stocks involved. It also provides context about the company's performance compared to the broader market. However, it doesn't highlight any solutions or progress, nor does it provide deep insights into the causes or impacts of these decisions.

title: Watch These AMD Stock Price Levels as 6-Session Winning Streak Snapped
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Advanced Micro Devices shares fell Thursday after gaining ground for six consecutive days amid optimism about recently announced AI deals and share buyback plans.
  • Momentum had accelerated in recent trading sessions after the stock broke out above the 50-day moving average and a descending channel, though the relative strength index flashed overbought conditions.
  • Investors should watch crucial support levels on AMD's chart around $110 and $96, while also monitoring important resistance levels near $132 and $150.


Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares fell Thursday after gaining ground for six consecutive days amid optimism about recently announced AI deals and share buyback plans.

The chip designer’s stock rallied to it highest level since early February on Wednesday after the company approved an additional $6 billion to its share repurchase plan, upping its buyback program to $10 billion. The buyback news came on the heels of the chipmaker and AI favorite Nvidia (NVDA) announcing Tuesday they would supply semiconductors to Saudi Arabian AI startup Humain as part of initiatives announced as President Donald Trump kicked off a four-day trip to the Middle East. 

AMD shares fell about 2% to just under $115 on Thursday. The stock is up 50% from its early-April low and has gained 17% since May 6, when the company posted better-than-expected earnings and an upbeat outlook driven by AI momentum.

Below, we take a closer look at the technicals on AMD’s chart and identify crucial price levels worth watching out for.

Momentum Accelerates

Since a bear trap marked the bottom in AMD shares last month, the price has broken out above the 50-day moving average and a descending channel, with gains accelerating in recent trading sessions.

However, while the relative strength index (RSI) confirms bullish price momentum with a reading above the 70 threshold, it also flashes overbought conditions, potentially leading to a period of-near-term consolidation.

Let’s identify crucial support and resistance levels on AMD’s chart that investors will likely be watching.

Crucial Support Levels to Watch

A pullback in the shares could initially bring the $110 level into play. The shares may find support in this area on the chart near the October 2023 swing high, which also closely corresponds with a range of trading activity between February and May this year.

Further downside could see the shares revisit lower support around $96. Investors may seek buying opportunities in this location near a horizontal line that connects three prominent troughs on the chart stretching back to the September 2023 low.

Important Resistance Levels to Monitor

A continuation of stock’s recent bullish momentum could propel a move northward toward $132, This area, currently just above the closely watched 200-day moving average, may provide overhead selling pressure near last August’s notable swing low and January’s countertrend high.

Finally, buying above this level opens the door for a rally up to the important $150 region. Investors who have accumulated AMD shares at lower prices may decide to lock in profits in this location near a trendline that links multiple peaks and troughs on the chart from December 2023 to November last year.

The comments, opinions, and analyses expressed on Investopedia are for informational purposes only. Read our warranty and liability disclaimer for more info.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.
titles: Watch These AMD Stock Price Levels as 6-Session Winning Streak Snapped
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares experienced a decline on Thursday, ending a six-day streak of gains fueled by excitement over new AI deals and an expanded share buyback program. The stock had rallied to its highest level since early February, following the announcement of a $6 billion increase to its buyback program, raising it to $10 billion. This news came shortly after AMD and Nvidia were chosen to supply semiconductors to a Saudi Arabian AI startup, coinciding with President Trump's Middle East visit. Despite the recent drop, AMD's stock is up 50% from its April low and has gained 17%
constructiveness_reason: This story offers useful information about AMD's stock performance, including the impact of recent news events. It helps readers understand the factors influencing the stock's price and could be useful for decision-making. However, it doesn't report on any solutions or improvements, and it doesn't provide deep insights into the causes or impacts of these trends.

title: Take-Two Interactive Stock Slips After 'GTA 6' Maker's Outlook Comes Up Short
snippets:
Take-Two Interactive (TTWO) reported fiscal fourth-quarter revenue that topped analysts’ expectations, but the gaming company's net loss and forecast disappointed.

The parent of popular video-game studios Rockstar Games and 2K reported revenue of $1.58 billion, up 13% year-over-year and above the analyst consensus from Visible Alpha. Net bookings climbed 17% to $1.58 billion, which also topped estimates.

Take-Two told investors to expect full-year revenue of $5.95 billion to $6.05 billion, along with a net loss of $439 million to $499 million. Wall Street was looking for revenue of $7.72 billion and earnings of $165 million, according to Visible Alpha.

The news comse two weeks after Take-Two announced Rockstar's hotly anticipated Grand Theft Auto VI game would be delayed until May 2026. That initially sent shares lower, although the release of a trailer for the game on May 6 helped renew investor optimism. 

CEO Strauss Zelnick said the company's upcoming lineup of games, including Grand Theft Auto VI, will "establish a new baseline for our business and set us on a path of enhanced profitability.”

Take-Two's net loss was $3.73 billion, or $21.08 per share, wider than the $2.9 billion, or $17.02 per share, it reported in the year-ago quarter. Take-Two said the loss was due in part of a $3.55 billion goodwill impairment charge.

Take-Two shares declined about 3% in after-hours trading. The stock is up 26% for 2025 through Thursday’s close.
titles: Take-Two Interactive Stock Slips After 'GTA 6' Maker's Outlook Comes Up Short
summary: Take-Two Interactive reported a fiscal fourth-quarter revenue of $1.58 billion, a 13% increase from the previous year, surpassing analysts' expectations. However, the company also reported a significant net loss of $3.73 billion, wider than last year's loss, mainly due to a $3.55 billion goodwill impairment charge. Despite this, net bookings rose by 17% to $1.58 billion. The company has adjusted its full-year revenue forecast to between $5.95 billion and $6.05 billion, with an anticipated net loss of $439 million to $499 million, disappointing Wall Street expectations. Designed for cuts, incisions, scrapes, and [...]
titles: Caltech’s Smart Bandage Detects Infection Days in Advance
summary: Caltech has developed a smart bandage, named iCares, that can detect infections in wounds days before they become apparent. This innovative bandage, created by Professor Wei Gao and his team, functions as a "lab on skin" by sampling fluid and tracking wound biomarkers. It aims to assist in early infection detection, predict healing outcomes, and potentially speed up the healing process for chronic wounds such as cuts, incisions, and scrapes.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive as it reports on an innovation that could potentially speed up the healing process for chronic wounds. title: Scientists Discover Temperature-Controlled Switch That Powers Fertility
snippets: A mouse study may pave the way for new approaches to contraception and infertility treatment. Sperm are surprisingly picky when it comes to temperature. In mammals, including humans, they perform best in environments that are a few degrees cooler than normal body temperature. This raises an intriguing question: how do these heat-sensitive cells manage to [...]
titles: Scientists Discover Temperature-Controlled Switch That Powers Fertility
summary: Scientists have discovered a temperature-controlled switch in sperm that could lead to new contraception and infertility treatments. This finding, based on a mouse study, highlights how sperm performance is optimal at temperatures slightly cooler than the typical body temperature in mammals, including humans. This research may significantly impact future approaches to reproductive health.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides a deeper understanding of reproductive health and reports on a discovery that could lead to new treatments for contraception and infertility. However, it lacks actionable insights for the general reader.

title: This Popular Anti-Aging Supplement Might Be a Waste of Money
snippets: Despite an 85% reduction in NAD+ levels, mice maintained normal muscle health and function, according to new research from the Treebak Group. Since natural aging typically causes only up to a 30% decline in NAD levels, these findings cast doubt on the purported health benefits promoted by NAD+ supplement companies. In the Netflix documentary Don’t [...]
titles: This Popular Anti-Aging Supplement Might Be a Waste of Money
summary: New research from the Treebak Group shows that even with an 85% reduction in NAD+ levels, mice maintained normal muscle health and function. This finding challenges the effectiveness of NAD+ supplements, which are marketed for anti-aging benefits. Considering natural aging results in up to a 30% decline in NAD levels, the study suggests these supplements might not provide the advertised health advantages.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides useful information for consumers about the potential ineffectiveness of NAD+ supplements. It increases awareness about the marketing of anti-aging products and their actual health benefits. However, it does not report on solutions or improvements.
